item.title: Deepika Padukone reveals striking outfit from wedding to Ranveer Singh - CNN
item.description:
Deepika Padukone reveals striking outfit from wedding to Ranveer Singh  CNN

One of the biggest names in Bollywood, Deepika Padukone, has married fellow actor Ranveer Singh in a star-studded ceremony in Lake Como, Italy. While the wedding was a closely-guarded affair -- the couple reportedly asked guests to follow a strict no-photo policy -- pictures emerged Thursday showing the model-turned-actress adorned in red and gold, lavish colors traditionally favored by Indian brides. The wedding was a two-day affair with local media reporting that two ceremonies took place, a Konkani ceremony on Wednesday followed by a Sindhi one, to reflect Padukone and Singh's background...

item.title: The Blame Game Begins As 'Jagga Jasoos' Collapses With Historic 84% 2nd Frame Plunge - Forbes Now
item.description:
The Blame Game Begins As 'Jagga Jasoos' Collapses With Historic 84% 2nd Frame Plunge  Forbes Now

‘Jagga Jasoos’ It was years in the making, but the final collapse for Jagga Jasoos into Indian box office infamy took only a few short days, like a long-melting snowbank that cascades all of a sudden into a calamitous avalanche. Prior to its release on July 14th, hopes were high for the Anurag Basu-directed, Ranbir Kapoor and Katrina Kaif-starring big budget comedy-musical from Disney Studios India. Basu and others were already chatting about a possible sequel in the expectation thatJagga Jasooswould be a hit. Kapoor, who not only starred but who was also a first-time producer on the film, ...

item.title: Karan Johar vs Ajay Devgn: Surprising Result In Bollywood Showdown - Forbes Now
item.description:
Karan Johar vs Ajay Devgn: Surprising Result In Bollywood Showdown  Forbes Now

Aishwarya Rai Bachchan (L) and Ranbir Kapoor in ‘Ae Dil Hai Mushkil’ (Photo: Fox Star Studios) Many pundits predicted a close-run race between Karan Johar’s romantic drama Ae Dil Hai Mushkil and Ajay Devgn’s action thriller Shivaay, which launched in India and Bollywood markets internationally last weekend. As it turned out, Johar’s tale of unrequited love was the decisive victor, although both film are expected to reach peak business levels in India today and tomorrow during the Diwali holidays, one of most lucrative trading periods of the year along with Eid and Christmas. There are no...

item.title: Ae Dil Hai Mushkil review – a traditional weepie, unlikely to offend - The Guardian
item.description:
Ae Dil Hai Mushkil review – a traditional weepie, unlikely to offend  The Guardian

From the controversy, a movie emerges. A Diwali release from superstar Hindi director Karan Johar was always likely to attract column inches, yet Ae Dil Hai Mushkil has landed more than anybody anticipated: India and Pakistan’s latest impasse has made Johar’s decision to cast Pakistani actor Fawad Khan the hottest of hot-button topics. Threats of suppression were met by a video message in which Johar sheepishly confessed he’d misread the national mood and, like many colleagues, pledged not to hire Pakistani creatives in future – an industry climbdown some found disappointing, coming so soon...

item.title: Doctor Strange sweeps into a new cosmic realm at UK box office - The Guardian
item.description:
Doctor Strange sweeps into a new cosmic realm at UK box office  The Guardian

The winner: Doctor Strange Disney-Marvel’s strategy of creating film franchises beyond its core Avengers group of characters has achieved its latest success with the release of Doctor Strange, starring Benedict Cumberbatch. A UK debut of £5.49m at the weekend and £9.29m including three days of previews represents a robustly encouraging result. While below the opening numbers of recent Avengers films, it compares favourably to Ant-Man’s debut of £4.01m in July last year, and is also better than Guardians of the Galaxy’s initial £4.99m plus £1.37m in previews in 2014. Marvel and parent Disney...

item.title: Indian Bollywood director: No more Pakistani talent - CNN
item.description:
Indian Bollywood director: No more Pakistani talent  CNN

One of India's most famous movie directors has released a different kind of video: a plea deal. Top Bollywood director Karan Johar dropped a bombshell Wednesday with a two-minute video explaining why he will no longer work with actors from Pakistan. "Nothing else matters to me but my country," Johar said in the video. "Going forward, I would like to say that of course I will not engage with talent from the neighboring country," he added, referring to Pakistan. It's difficult Johar has faced potential bans and threats of violence over his latest movie "Ae Dil Hai Mushkil" -- which loosely tr...

item.title: Advance Sales Point To Strong Debuts For Devgn's 'Shivaay' And Johar's 'Ae Dil Hain Mushkil' - Forbes Now
item.description:
Advance Sales Point To Strong Debuts For Devgn's 'Shivaay' And Johar's 'Ae Dil Hain Mushkil'  Forbes Now

‘Shivaay’s’ Abigail Eames and Ajay Devgn (Photo: Eros International) The first reviews are generally positive for Ajay Devgn’s action thriller Shivaay and Karan Johar’s romantic drama Ae Dil Hai Mushkil, which launched today in India and Bollywood-friendly markets. Judging by advance bookings, Johar’s film may do slightly better in India on opening day but both are expected to reach peak business levels on Monday and Tuesday with the Diwali holidays, one of most lucrative trading periods of the year along with Eid and Christmas. Ticket sales for Johar’s film were stronger at multiplexes in ...

item.title: Mumbai police vow to protect cinemas showing film with Pakistani actor - The Guardian
item.description:
Mumbai police vow to protect cinemas showing film with Pakistani actor  The Guardian

Mumbai police have set up a hotline and pledged extra security for any cinemas that choose to show an upcoming Bollywood blockbuster starring a Pakistani actor, as ultranationalist groups threaten to disrupt screenings with violence. As the potential for renewed military conflict between India and Pakistan appears to ebb after a series of violent incidents last month, the battle has moved to the countries’ entertainment industries, with Pakistan announcing a total ban on Indian television or radio content on Thursday. The film, Ae Dil Hai Mushkil, is a romantic drama scheduled for release d...

item.title: Disney India Hopes To Repeat 'Dangal' Magic With Kapoor-Kaif Caper 'Jagga Jasoos' - Forbes Now
item.description:
Disney India Hopes To Repeat 'Dangal' Magic With Kapoor-Kaif Caper 'Jagga Jasoos'  Forbes Now

A month out from its July 14th release date, Disney India Studios released the latest poster on Thursday for its oft-rescheduled musical romantic comedy Jagga Jasoos. Jagga Jasoos tells the story of a gifted teenage detective, played by Kapoor, who is accompanied by a female companion (Kaif) on a quest to find his missing father. At 34 years old Kapoor may seem a bit long in the tooth to be playing a teenager, but it’s been done before. Bollywood superstar reluctantly took on the role of an 18-year-old college student when he was actually 44, and the resulting film, 3 Idiots, was an enormou...

item.title: Bollywood's Search For A Hit Continues As 'Jagga Jasoos' Fizzles With $1.33 M Day 1 - Forbes Now
item.description:
Bollywood's Search For A Hit Continues As 'Jagga Jasoos' Fizzles With $1.33 M Day 1  Forbes Now

‘Jagga Jasoos’ opened on Friday, July 14th. It has been a rough summer so far for Bollywood, with only one film breaking the 100 crore rupees threshold this season, and that picture, Salman Khan’s Tubelight, widely deemed a disappointment. Though Friday was only the first day for Jagga Jasoos, a kids-oriented comedy-musical that should see nice bumps at the box office on Saturday and Sunday, the first day tally of 8.5 crore rupees has signaled that this is not the hit Bollywood has been patiently awaiting. The first day collections fell below those of several other 2017 Bollywood releases, ...

item.title: For Disney's Comedy-Musical 'Jagga Jasoos', The $16 Million Budget Is A Big Problem - Forbes Now
item.description:
For Disney's Comedy-Musical 'Jagga Jasoos', The $16 Million Budget Is A Big Problem  Forbes Now

‘Jagga Jasoos’ is Disney india’s latest family film. The process of making and distributing a movie necessarily involves a tremendous amount of detail and complexity, but ultimately there are only a few things that must be done right for the venture to achieve success. First and foremost, of course, is the requirement to deliver a film that works—that is, a coherent story with engaging, empathetic characters facing meaningful conflict that appeals to the audience it is intended to reach. Second, the film must be budgeted appropriately in order to maximize its chances of financial success. M...

item.title: Karan Johar And Ajay Devgn Set To Continue Their Hot Streaks In India - Forbes Now
item.description:
Karan Johar And Ajay Devgn Set To Continue Their Hot Streaks In India  Forbes Now

Ranbir Kapoor and Anushka Sharma in ‘Ae Dil Hai Mushkil’ (Photo: Fox Star Studios) Karan Johar’s romantic drama Ae Dil Hai Mushkil starring Ranbir Kapoor and Anushka Sharma and Ajay Devgn’s action-thriller Shivaay have dominated the Diwali holidays in their first week in India as well as collecting tidy sums internationally. That dominance looks certain to continue this weekend despite the launches of Disney/Marvel’s Doctor Strange and Fox/DreamWorks Animation’s Trolls plus Hindi releases 2016 The End and the long-delayed Mahayoddha Rama. Scott Derrickson’s superhero adventure starring Ben...

item.title: The War Of Trailers: Zero And 2.0 Trailers See Unprecedented Views - Forbes
item.description:
The War Of Trailers: Zero And 2.0 Trailers See Unprecedented Views  Forbes

It’s been a huge few weeks for Hindi film lovers with the trailers for Zero and 2.0 being released within a day of one another. On November 2, which is the birthday of superstar Shahrukh Khan, the trailer for his next release, Zero released, a whole year after his last film When Harry Met Sejal. While throngs of people crowded around the actor’s house on his birthday in the hope of catching a glimpse of “King Khan”, even more took to the internet with baited breath, waiting for the trailer’s release. The trailer on YouTube already has around 100 million views. The film, directed by Aanand L...

item.title: Thugs of Hindostan review – Bollywood swashbuckler takes on Disney's Pirates - The Guardian
item.description:
Thugs of Hindostan review – Bollywood swashbuckler takes on Disney's Pirates  The Guardian

Boosted by the huge box-office success of SS Rajamouli’s Baahubali, commercial Indian cinema has big things planned before the year is out. Among them are Tamil superstar Rajinikanth’s return in 2.0 and Shah Rukh Khan reducing himself to a visual effect in the Christmas release Zero. Thugs of Hindostan, however, is the biggest of all: a 164-minute period swashbuckler that deploys Bollywood’s grandest-ever budget and megastars Aamir Khan and Amitabh Bachchan to stage a pirate uprising against the East India Company. As if that weren’t enough, it’s also playing widely in Imax. As the use of B...

item.title: Thugs Of Hindostan: This Year's Big Bollywood Diwali Release - Forbes
item.description:
Thugs Of Hindostan: This Year's Big Bollywood Diwali Release  Forbes

Diwali, arguably India’s most popular festival, is always a highly anticipated time for film lovers in the country. Through years, the most star studded and eagerly awaited films have chosen Diwali for their time of release. Traditionally, there are multiple Diwali releases, each boasting of high budgets and big stars, that fight it out at the box office. Given the festive mood and good cheer among people, these films have had a record of reaping in huge profits. The poster for this year’s Diwali Release, Thugs of Hindostan In 2013, Hrithik Roshan’s superhero drama Krrish 3 released two day...

item.title: Bahraini royal sued for £35m in Britain's High Court after 'breaking agreement' to meet Bollywood stars - The Independent
item.description:
Bahraini royal sued for £35m in Britain's High Court after 'breaking agreement' to meet Bollywood stars  The Independent

A member of the Bahraini royal family is being sued for £35m at Britain’s High Court after he allegedly pulled out of an “extraordinary” deal to spend time with dozens of Bollywood stars. Sheikh Hamad Isa Ali al-Khalifa is accused of reneging on an exclusive agreement with an Egyptian businessman, who offered to set up 15-minute meetings with film A-listers at luxury hotels in India and Dubai. The royal, a cousin of the King of Bahrain and a nephew of the country’s deputy prime minister, is said to have drawn up a list of 26 Bollywood stars he wanted to meet, including Anil Kapoor, Amitabh ...

item.title: Heatwave and World Cup results in awful weekend at box office - The Guardian
item.description:
Heatwave and World Cup results in awful weekend at box office  The Guardian

The winner: the weather A combination of sizzling temperatures and World Cup football saw box office receipts plummet in the UK, as audiences shunned the cinema in favour of TV screens and outdoor pursuits. The market delivered its second worst weekend for cinemagoing so far this year. The only session that performed worse in 2018 was the weekend prior to the release of Avengers: Infinity War, which was notably weak for new releases, and was also hit by sunny weather. The top title at the weekend was once again Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom, which is one of three films this year – along wi...

item.title: Sanju review – biopic of Bollywood bad boy Sanjay Dutt drowns in self-evasion - The Guardian
item.description:
Sanju review – biopic of Bollywood bad boy Sanjay Dutt drowns in self-evasion  The Guardian

The career of Bollywood megastar Sanjay Dutt has been the rockiest of rides. Born to Nargis, iconic figurehead of 1957’s Mother India, Dutt’s initial breakthrough was stymied by drink, drugs and womanising, and subsequent comebacks separated by stretches of prison time. His air of disrepute bolstered 2006’s terrific comedy Lage Raho Munna Bhai, where Dutt played a heavy nagged towards virtue by Gandhi’s ghost: the gags there had the ring of hard truth. That film’s director Rajkumar Hirani now brings us a decidedly soft and authorised-looking biopic featuring boyish pin-up Ranbir Kapoor as t...

item.title: From Padmavat To Zero: Bollywood Films To Watch Out For In 2018 - Forbes Now
item.description:
From Padmavat To Zero: Bollywood Films To Watch Out For In 2018  Forbes Now

Deepika Padukone in Padmavat. This year, Bollywood filmmakers are ready to let their creativity fly by bringing a number of films to the big screen that will happily sweep us away from reality. From the perplexing plot of Thugs of Hindostan and Padmavat to an avalanche of highly anticipated varied pleasures, here’s a roundup of the most anticipated films featuring some of Bollywood’s biggest talents that we’ll most be looking forward to in 2018. Padmavat The blockbuster, starring superstars Deepika Padukone, Ranveer Singh and Shahid Kapoor, is an operatic version of a Sufi poem Padmavat, de...

item.title: Just How Leggy Are Salman's Hits Compared To Aamir's, SRK's And Others? - Forbes Now
item.description:
Just How Leggy Are Salman's Hits Compared To Aamir's, SRK's And Others?  Forbes Now

Indian actors Aamir Khan (L) and Salman Khan in 2009. (Photo credit: STRDEL/AFP/Getty Images) I’ve received a few notes from readers regarding my headline yesterday in which I boldly proclaimed a ₹475 crore ($74 million) global box office gross for Tiger Zinda Hai as being “locked.” One reader asked whether I was aware that the grosses for Salman Khan’s movies tend to collapse after their first week in theaters. I was aware of that fact, though I had never done a detailed investigation. Now I have, and I’m going to share my results with you. I decided to look at Salman’s recent hits, and ho...
